column4: slight problem, I accidentally removed some packages via synaptic.. now I can't seem to install them with either synaptic,adept,apt-get, or aptitude
anyone know if totally removing packages makes it very difficult to restore them?
right nwo all that matches beryl is libberyldecoration0 and libberylsettings0
If you no longer have the repo enabled, or those packages no longer exist on the repo, then that may happen.
oh. perhaps that's why it's bugged out ever since i upgraded to gutsy
In any case, are you trying to install Beryl? And if so, is there a reason you want to use it instead of Compiz (which ships with Gutsy)?
i was using beryl, thought that was the more well-known fork
Ahh, remember that the dist-upgrader in Ubuntu will disable all your 3rd party repos.
Well, I don't know if you've already heard, but Beryl's discontinued and all the work is going into Compiz and Compiz Fusion. Check in at #compiz-fusion if you have any more questions on this. :)
I don't have third party ones, but I do have all the restricted/universe/multiverse
hopefully compiz has the handy fullscreen thing
alt-enter and most apps would toggle (was a setting in beryl's config)
thanks, worked fine, and i'm upgraded properly
That fullscreen toggling action is now in a plugin called "extrawm" (Extra WM Actions), which is inside compiz-fusion-plugins-extra.
ahh, downloading everything that matched compiz right now
If you used the standard dist-upgrader I think compiz would have been auto-installed already... maybe not plugins-extra though.
know where compiz settings are stored, for Ring Switcher? I can't seem to set the key macro in Actions
For Compiz-specific questions I would recommend that you ask in #compiz-fusion
